text: Elijah J. McCoy (May 2, 1844 - October 10, 1929) was an African American inventor who is best known for inventing lubrication devices to make trains run better. He was born in Colchester, Ontario and died in Detroit, Michigan. He was born May 2, 1844. He was an engineer and inventor, initially employed as a railroad fireman and oiler and fudger. ==References== Category:1844 births Category:1929 deaths Category:African- American people Category:Engineers from Michigan Category:American inventors Category:Canadian inventors Category:Firefighters Category:Businesspeople from Ontario
